member.name: IMFSensorGroup.CreateMediaSource
member.summary: Creates an that virtualizes the sensor group. The term "device" in this context could refer to a physical device or a software media source. The source can represent a sensor group that actually contains multiple sensor devices, or it could contain only a single device, but still behaves as a sensor group.
member.param: Receives a pointer to the created media source.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFSensorGroup.GetDefaultSensorDeviceIndex
member.summary: Retrieves the index of the default device in the sensor group.
member.param: If the call succeeds, pdwIndex receives the index of the default device.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The sensor group has not been initialized.

member.name: IMFSensorGroup.GetFlags
member.summary: Gets the flags set for the sensor group.
member.param: The flags set for the sensor group

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The sensor group has not been initialized.

member.name: IMFSensorGroup.GetSensorDevice
member.summary: Gets the corresponding to a device in the sensor group.
member.param: The 0-based index of the device to be retrieved. The index must be between 0 and the value returned by - 1.
If the call is successful, ppDevice will contain the retrieved sensor device.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: the dwIndex parameter is not in the valid range.
The sensor group has not been initialized.

member.name: IMFSensorGroup.GetSensorDeviceCount
member.summary: Gets the number of devices that are virtualized by the sensor group.
member.param: The number of devices in the sensor group.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The sensor group has not been initialized.

member.name: IMFSensorGroup.GetSensorGroupAttributes
member.summary: Gets the for the sensor group. The returned object is a live reference to the internal attribute store.
member.param: The interface representing the internal attribute store of the sensor group.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The sensor group has not been initialized.

member.name: IMFSensorGroup.GetSymbolicLink
member.summary: Gets the symbolic link name of the sensor group.
member.param: Buffer of cchSymbolicLink characters where the symbolic link name will be written. The buffer must be large enough to account for the null terminator.
Number of characters available in SymbolicLink buffer.

Output parameter containing the number of characters written to SymbolicLink. This includes the null terminator. If SymbolicLink is null and cchSymbolicLink is 0, pcchWritten will contain the number of characters needed (including the null terminator) to store the symbolic link name.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The buffer provided in the SymbolicLink parameter is not large enough to contain the symbolic link name, including the null terminator.
The sensor group has not been initialized.

member.name: IMFSensorGroup.SetDefaultSensorDeviceIndex
member.summary: Configures one of the devices in the sensor group as the default device.
member.param: 0-based index of the device to be set as default. The index must be between 0 and the value returned by - 1.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: the dwIndex parameter is not in the valid range.
The sensor group has not been initialized.

member.name: IMFSensorGroup
member.summary: Represents a group of sensor devices from which an can be created. The term "device" in this context could refer to a physical device, a custom media source, or a frame provider. A sensor group may actually contain multiple sensor devices, or it could contain only a single device, but it still behaves as a sensor group.
